meanings.definition: A small, flat, thin piece or layer.
meanings.sent1: She found a flake of paint on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The snowflake landed gently on her glove.
meanings.sent3: The flake of chocolate on his shirt made him look like a messy eater.
meanings.sent4: Her heart shattered like a delicate flake of glass.
meanings.sent5: The flake of gold shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A small piece broken off a larger piece.
meanings.sent1: He brushed off a flake of pastry from his shirt.
meanings.sent2: The flake of bark fell from the tree and landed on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The flake of cookie crumbled in her hand.
meanings.sent4: His confidence was just a flake of what it used to be.
meanings.sent5: The flake of paper floated down from the desk.

meanings.definition: A person who is unreliable or inconsistent in behavior.
meanings.sent1: She knew he was a flake and couldn't be counted on.
meanings.sent2: The flake never showed up for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The flake of a friend always had an excuse for canceling plans.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as a flake spread quickly among his peers.
meanings.sent5: Being labeled a flake hurt her feelings deeply.

meanings.definition: To break or come off in small, thin pieces.
meanings.sent1: The old paint began to flake off the wall.
meanings.sent2: Her skin started to flake after spending too much time in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The pastry chef watched the crust flake perfectly in the oven.
meanings.sent4: His resolve began to flake away under the pressure.
meanings.sent5: The cliff face continued to flake away due to erosion.
